CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. P5 - This refers to the material "P5".
2. P6 - This refers to the material "P6".
3. P7 - This refers to the material "P7".
4. PC61BM - This refers to the material "PC61BM".
5. PC71BM - This refers to the material "PC71BM".

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

* P5
* P6
* P7
* PC61BM
* PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PC61BM
2. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. P5 - This refers to the property of the fifth polymer being studied.
2. P6 - This refers to the property of the sixth polymer being studied.
3. P7 - This refers to the property of the seventh polymer being studied.
4. PC61BM - This refers to the property of a blend of polymer (61) and a solubilizing agent (BM).
5. PC71BM - This refers to the property of a blend of polymer (71) and a solubilizing agent (BM).

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. P5
2. P6
3. P7
4. PC61BM
5. PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the paragraph:

1. PCE values - This refers to the Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency values of the blends.
2. PC61BM - This refers to the material property of a blend of polymer (61) and a solubilizing agent (BM).
3. PC71BM - This refers to the material property of a blend of polymer (71) and a solubilizing agent (BM).

So, the relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the paragraph are:

1. PCE values
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to Material Property in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE values |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: P5 , P6 , and P7 blended with PC61BM showed higher PCE values than when they were blended with PC71BM in spite of the better light absorption of PC71BM , which is most likely due to the lower miscibility of those polymers with PC71BM.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - This is a measure of the efficiency of converting sunlight into electrical energy in solar cells.
2. PC61BM (Polymeric Material) - This is a specific type of polymer used in the blends.
3. PC71BM (Polymeric Material) - This is another specific type of polymer used in the blends.
4. miscibility (a measure of how well two substances mix together) - This is a property of the polymers and their ability to mix with each other.

So, the Property Value entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency)
2. PC61BM (Polymeric Material)
3. PC71BM (Polymeric Material)
4. miscibility (a measure of how well two substances mix together)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - This is a measure of the efficiency of converting sunlight into electrical energy in solar cells.
2. PC61BM (Polymeric Material) - This is a specific type of polymer used in the blends, and its value is mentioned in the context of its photovoltaic conversion efficiency.
3. PC71BM (Polymeric Material) - Similarly, this is another specific type of polymer used in the blends, and its value is mentioned in the context of its photovoltaic conversion efficiency.

So, the relevant entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph are:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency)
2. PC61BM (Polymeric Material)
3. PC71BM (Polymeric Material)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) |
| PC61BM (Polymeric Material) |
| PC71BM (Polymeric Material) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
